description: Commands to manage Config Server git repository in Azure Spring Apps.

commands.name: az spring config-server git repo add
commands.summary: Add a new repository of git property of Config Server.
commands.syntax:
az spring config-server git repo add --repo-name
                                     --resource-group
                                     --service
                                     --uri
                                     [--defer]
                                     [--host-key]
                                     [--host-key-algorithm]
                                     [--host-key-check]
                                     [--label]
                                     [--password]
                                     [--pattern]
                                     [--private-key]
                                     [--search-paths]
                                     [--username]
examples: az spring config-server git repo add -s MyService -g MyResourceGroup --uri UrlOfGitRepository --repo-name GitRepoName

commands.name: az spring config-server git repo list
commands.summary: List all repositories of git property of Config Server.
commands.syntax:
az spring config-server git repo list --resource-group
                                      --service
                                      [--defer]
examples: az spring config-server git repo list -s MyService -g MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az spring config-server git repo remove
commands.summary: Remove an existing repository of git property of Config Server.
commands.syntax:
az spring config-server git repo remove --repo-name
                                        --resource-group
                                        --service
                                        [--defer]
                                        [--yes]
examples: az spring config-server git repo remove -s MyService -g MyResourceGroup --repo-name GitRepoName

commands.name: az spring config-server git repo update
commands.summary: Override an existing repository of git property of Config Server, will totally override the old one.
commands.syntax:
az spring config-server git repo update --repo-name
                                        --resource-group
                                        --service
                                        [--defer]
                                        [--host-key]
                                        [--host-key-algorithm]
                                        [--host-key-check]
                                        [--label]
                                        [--password]
                                        [--pattern]
                                        [--private-key]
                                        [--search-paths]
                                        [--uri]
                                        [--username]
examples: az spring config-server git repo update -s MyService -g MyResourceGroup --uri UrlOfGitRepository --repo-name GitRepoName --label LabelOfGitRepository
